chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Carolyn A. Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid jointly & severally with co-defendant.

Court orders a minimum payment plan of $150/mo commencing 4/7/17 and continuing on the 7th day of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Court orders restitution to be collected first & paid in full before the Department collects money for the court costs and supervision fees.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

To be paid during term of supervision, but after restitution is paid in full.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
To submit to DNA sample at the Ozaukee County Sheriff's Dept by 4/8/17.

Letter Court re: Agent's memo on court obligations
sent via DOC interface
Memo DOC Re: Court Obligations - doc for review to clerk DA

11:32 AM All parties appearing by video/telephonic means. Defendant Carolyn Robinson in court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Jennifer Kappelman  also appears. Court provided update as to payments. Court directs the Department to request a review should it be necessary.

Controller confirmed with DOC Cashier defendant has made the following payments:  2/27/2020  $200.00, 4/1/2020 $125.47 & 4/29/2020 $159.00, payments have also been made by co-defendant. Balance owed on joint & several restitution is $1,500.00.
Review hearing on May 29, 2020 at 11:30 am.

Pursuant to the Wisconsins Supreme Courts Order issued March 22, 2020, the May 29, 2020, hearing is being held via video and telephone conferencing.  You may join this hearing by video using the following website: https://zoom.us/j/913 5945 0407 (meeting ID: /913 5945 0407) or you may join the hearing by phone by calling 1-312-626-6799 (meeting ID: /913 5945 0407).
Review hearing on May 29, 2020 at 11:30 am.
RESCHEDULED FROM 4/7/20 BY THE COURT

State by ADA Lindsey.  Defendant appears in person.  Agent Jennifer Kappelman appears in person.  Defendant confirms no payments made indicating on disability and unable to pay.  Court questions agent on what the department has done in working with defendant for payments.  Agent advises defendant just signed agreement for extension of probation.  Agent indicates just recently became the agent for this defendant and advises of the numeruous attempts made with the Dept of Corrections in the State of Tennessee without any return calls from that agency.  Court examines agent on why the Dept is allowing the interstate compact if cooperation not being made.  Defendant explains that an agent in Tennessee has met with the defendant 9 times in a 2 year period, but that the agent never discussed repayment arrangements for the restitution.  Court examines defendant on expenses..  Court finds the defendant has the ability to pay and orders a $100 payment this month and $100 payment by 3/3 and then $100 payment continuing on the 3rd day of each month thereafter.  Court orders continued review on 4/7 at 11:30 am.  Court advises defendant if payments are not made, may be taken into custody at next hearing.
Clerk tendered copy of Notice of Hearing and Order for Extending Probation to defendant while in court for Motion Hearing today.
Review hearing on April 7, 2020 at 11:30 am.

11:32 AM Defendant Carolyn A. Robinson in court.  Probation Agent Jennifer Kappelman in court. Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advises Court currently on social security. Agent Kappelman states has been supervising defendant since September 2019 and has not had any contact with the defendant till now. Agent Kappelman advises filed for extended supervision due to the fact defendant still has not paid restitution. Defendant advises has met with probation agent from Tennessee 9 times in the last 2 years including home and office visits, last visit was in November of 2019. State moves to have defendants probation extended for 2 years. Court directs defendant to pay $100/month starting today and the first of every month. Court to sign order for extended probation. Defendant's new discharge date will be March 8, 2022.  Review hearing scheduled for April 7, 2020 at 11:30 am.
for Extending Probation/Restitution/Court Ordered Financial Obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Carolyn A. Robinson in court with attorney Barbara J. Privat.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 8, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Carolyn A. Robinson in court with attorney Barbara J. Privat.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has received pretrial offer and requests additional time to look into transfering probation out of state.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Further proceedings on February 14, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea.

Case recalled. Defendant Carolyn A. Robinson in court with attorney Barbara J. Privat.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel indicates her client will be waiving preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts said waiver and binds matter over for trial. State informs. Defendant gives updated out of state address and cellphone number. State has no objection to out of state residency of defendant.  Further proceedings scheduled for February 14, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Prior: 3919 N. 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Defendant Carolyn A. Robinson in court with attorney Barbara J. Privat.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case to be recalled for counsel to discuss preliminary hearing with client.
Not to leave the state of WI without written permission.

Defendant Carolyn A. Robinson in court with attorney Rachel Marie Boaz as friend of the court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for public defender, however Attorney Boaz has a conflict with this case. Court advises of penalties. Counsel waives reading of complaint. State recommends $250 cash bail. Court sets bail. Counsel waives time limits requesting a status on prelim hearing.  Status hearing scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Sheriff dispatch advises defendant is in custody.

Defendant Carolyn A. Robinson not in court. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause. Based on non-appearance by defendant, court forfeits any bail and issues warrant.
